description: Dive into "Chaweng's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chaweng's Coastal Escapes: Beach Bliss

places.generalDescription: Chaweng Beach, located on the east coast of Koh Samui, is a popular destination known for its pristine shoreline and vibrant nightlife. Divided into three sections - North Chaweng, Central Chaweng, and Chaweng Noi - this beach attracts a diverse crowd of young travelers and families. The area offers an array of water activities such as jet skiing and climbing on inflatable devices like trampolines and rockers.

sources.snippet: A part of the Chaweng Beach, Chaweng Noi Beach is preferred by those who want to enjoy the proximity of the Chaweng market but wish for solitary relaxation. Close to the happening night life of Chaweng, the beach maintains its privacy and offers accommodation options for those who like the silent time with all the luxuries of modern life. Standing away from the popular Chaweng beach and yet not inaccessible, Chaweng Noi is perfect for lazy, long strolls and sunbathing.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Koh Samui For A Fun Filled Vacation in 2024

sources.snippet: Located right in the center of Koh Samui‚Äôs eastern coast, Chaweng Noi Beach is known for its clean water and fun-loving crowd. Chaweng Noi Beach is adjacent to other Chaweng beaches, but they‚Äôre separated by a narrow inlet that acts as a natural barrier, which tends to keep the crowds and beach debris to a minimum making it feel more secluded than it really is. Chaweng Noi has enough activities available to keep most guests satisfied.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Our pick of the best beaches around Koh Samui is Chaweng Noi beach (most beautiful), Silver beach and Coral Cove beach (best snorkeling), Lipa Noi beach and Choeng Mon beach (most quiet). Overall, Koh Samui does not disappoint, giving you an assortment of beautiful beaches alongside fantastic experiences to make them all worth it. Fortunately, all the best beaches are just a short ride from one another.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Koh Samui review ~ Thailand

sources.snippet: Chaweng Beach is, without a doubt, one of the most popular beaches in Thailand, and rightly so. While beaches on Koh Samui are abundant, Chaweng stands out for several reasons. Taking its name from the largest town of Koh Samui that‚Äôs just nearby, Chaweng is the most popular beach of the island.
sources.shortName: Chaweng Beach: The Best White Sand Beach on Koh Samui

sources.snippet:
T
 he sand on Chaweng Noi Beach is of tender creamy shade and is very fine. The colour of water is purely blue, depending on 
 light transforming into greenish turquoise colour. The entrance into the sea is smooth.
sources.shortName: Ko Samui Beaches Guide ‚Äì www.kosamui.space

places.name: Chaweng Beach

reviews.text:
This is a very nice beach....
Lots of room if you don't want to be around too many people.
It gets very busy, mostly a younger crowd but still a few oldies like me.
I really liked the mixture of people there.
Sometimes the sea was a bit rough, but when it was calm wow, fantastic crystal clear water....
Best most beautiful beach on the island. Gentle waves, white sand, transparent water, just perfect! Silver beach is nice too but too small and crowded. Love the granite boulders there though üèùÔ∏è

WOW, Chaweng Beach is an absolute paradise! The long stretch of soft, powdery white sand meets the crystal-clear turquoise waters, creating a perfect postcard scene. The beach is lively yet never feels overcrowded, with plenty of spots to relax under the shade of palm trees or soak up the sun. Swimming is wonderful here, as the water is warm and gentle, and the shallow shoreline makes it ideal for all ages. We had intentions of visiting other beaches during our month stay but we just couldn't resist the convenience of Chaweng Beach.

What makes Chaweng truly special is the balance between natural beauty and vibrant atmosphere - you can enjoy peaceful moments in the morning, then experience exciting beach bars, delicious restaurants, and charming shops just steps away. The sunsets are breathtaking, and it's located near Central Samui.

Whether you're after relaxation, water sports, or a bit of nightlife, Chaweng Beach offers it all in one magical place. A must-visit when in Koh Samui!

places.address: 3/55 Thesaban Nakhon Ko Samui, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Noori India, located in Chaweng South on Cheweng Beach road, is a well-established Indian restaurant run by two brothers who have poured their knowledge and dedication into the establishment. The menu offers traditional Indian dishes as well as seafood and Thai-Indian fusion cuisine. With over 20 vegetarian options available, the restaurant caters to vegetarians with authentic and flavorful dishes. The dining experience is enhanced by red carpeted interiors adorned with beautiful paintings of Rajasthan.

sources.snippet: Run by two passionate brothers, this cozy spot offers delicious Indian classics like crispy samosas and creamy butter chicken, with halal and vegetarian options for all.
sources.shortName: Chaweng Beach

places.name: Noori India (‡∏ô‡∏π‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏≠‡∏¥‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏¢) | Best Indian Restaurant in Koh Samui | South Indian Food | Jain Food | Vegan Food | Veg Food

reviews.text: We came here for dinner. Best indian food on Koh Samui so far. Everything fresh and delicious. The owner came to our table to ask if everything is alright, super friendly, service was excellent. The small complimentary starter was also very good. Will defnitely come back again

A little slice of India in Koh Samui!

Noori India is hands down my favorite spot on Samui - and for one very special reason: it's the only place on the island that serves Masala Dosa! I fell in love with Masala Dosa years ago in India, when a taxi driver pulled over at a tiny roadside shack at 5 am and treated me to this amazing breakfast. Ever since, I have to eat it wherever I find it - so you can imagine how thrilled I am that it's finally available right here in Chaweng!

Long story short: the food is delicious, the restaurant is clean and air-conditioned (huge plus in this heat!), and the waiter was so friendly and bubbly, he made the whole experience even better.

Great food, lovely service, cool inside - what more do you need? I'll definitely be back for my Masala Dosa fix. Highly recommend! üå∏
After waiting over 30 minutes (wasn't busy) my chips were cold and stale, the burger was nothing like the photo on the menu, it was like lamb flavoured cardboard. I left most of it.

places.address: 17, 1 ‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô ‡∏´‡∏≤‡∏î‡πÄ‡∏â‡∏ß‡∏á, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Coral Cove Beach, located on the east coast of Koh Samui, is a serene and unspoiled slice of paradise. Despite its small size, this beach boasts reddish sand, turquoise waters, beautiful palm trees, and dramatic boulders that create a picturesque backdrop for relaxation, water activities, or photo shoots. It is considered one of the best beaches in the area for snorkeling.

sources.snippet: Coral Cove Beach is not a very well known beach in Koh Samui, so it is more appealing to visitors who seek a private piece of paradise with calm, quiet and seclusion. The beach is roughly 200 meters in length, yet remarkably you‚Äôll find more space for yourself here than in the busy Chaweng. On both sides of the beach, there are boulders and rock formations creating the perfect frame and the ever-present Samui coconut trees are in view.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Our pick of the best beaches around Koh Samui is Chaweng Noi beach (most beautiful), Silver beach and Coral Cove beach (best snorkeling), Lipa Noi beach and Choeng Mon beach (most quiet). Overall, Koh Samui does not disappoint, giving you an assortment of beautiful beaches alongside fantastic experiences to make them all worth it. Fortunately, all the best beaches are just a short ride from one another.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Koh Samui review ~ Thailand

sources.snippet: Coral Cove Beach is a small secluded cove located between the better-known beaches of Chaweng and Lamai, on the east coast of Koh Samui. This intimate beach, about 180 meters long, is characterized by its fine golden sand, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and the impressive granite rocks that frame it. Its name comes from the coral formations near the shore, offering excellent snorkeling opportunities.
sources.shortName: Top 08 Best Beaches In Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Coral Cove Beach in southwestern Koh Samui, has reddish sand and clear, deep seas, making it perfect for a day of swimming and relaxing. It's the ideal spot for those who value their privacy. The clean seas are ideal for snorkelling, with coral and schools of tropical fish visible along the coast of Coral Cove Beach.The rock formations on either end are ideal for open-air rock climbing.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Koh Samui For A Fun Filled Vacation in 2024

sources.snippet: The Coral Cove Beach is located on the way from Chaweng to Lamai. You can have a short glimpse at the beach on the left side of the road. There are a few accommodations like the Coral Cove Chalet or Hi Coral Cove Bungalow on the beach area, but the quite small beach isn‚Äôt visited much.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches ‚Äì The 12 Most Beautiful Bays on the Island

sources.snippet: The Coral Cove Beach is a dream beach like out of a postcard!. Here you will find beautiful palm trees and the rocks make this bay an incredibly picturesque place. The water here is crystal clear and invites for swimming.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (2024)

sources.snippet: Positioned on the same headland as Silver Beach, Coral Cove is a superb, tranquil spot. This is the beach in Koh Samui that you will come across on YouTube most often. It really is very picturesque.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Koh Samui: 2024 Guide +Map

sources.snippet: Coral Cove Beach is, for many, the best beach in all of Koh Samui. It‚Äôs characterised by a rocky, rugged coastline that frames the bay, breathtaking ocean views, and a stunning natural environment.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches - Best Swimming, Diving, Snorkelling & Resorts, Map

places.name: Coral Cove Beach

reviews.text:
A small but exquisite beach. Post card typical Thai cove beach. Clear waters, abundant coral and fish.

There is a restaurant where you can get very reasonably priced food and drink. You can park for free at the top of the hill just off the main road.

10/10 beach definitely check it out.

It can get busy but if you go in the morning before 11 it's super quiet.

Beautiful beach with amazing edges full of big rock formations and spectacular snorkeling opportunities. If you visit,
DO rent the googles and see what is under the surface. The beach itself is quiet and there are usually not so many y people. On the video, you can see how clean it is, but behind me, there is a trash everywhere. Large piles of it.  When you walk around, the garbage is also kinda visible in the sand. There are many plastic pieces,cigarettes and whatnot... There is a little parking where around 5-6 cars can fit. Scooters won't have any issues.

This is such a lovely beach with beautifully clear water. You can even spot little fish swimming in the shallows, which absolutely thrilled my kids. It's a wonderful place for families to enjoy and feels very peaceful. The only thing to watch out for is some dog poo on the sand everywhere, so just be mindful when walking around. Other than that, it's a truly delightful spot to spend the day

places.address: F3R6+6GC, 4169, Tambon Bo Put, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Bo Phut Beach, located in the north of Koh Samui, is a modest yet charming destination that offers a mix of natural beauty and cultural experiences. The beach is divided into two sections: Bophut Beach itself and the renowned Fisherman's Village. This village is known for its well-preserved elegance, with wooden Chinese shop-houses blending seamlessly with modern buildings to create a Mediterranean atmosphere. It was once the main French outpost on the island.

sources.snippet: Bophut Beach, located in the north of Koh Samui, stands out for its unique blend of historical charm and relaxing beach atmosphere. This 3-kilometer-long beach is famous for its "Fisherman's Village," a former fishing village transformed into a picturesque area with shops, restaurants, and bars set in traditional wooden houses. The golden sand and calm waters of Bophut make it an ideal place for swimming and relaxation, while its pier offers panoramic views of the sea and neighboring islands.
sources.shortName: Top 08 Best Beaches In Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Located on the northern coast of Koh Samui, Bophut Beach exudes a charming and laid-back ambiance, with a picturesque blend of traditional Thai wooden houses and modern amenities. The beach is dotted with cozy beachfront cafes, where visitors can savor delectable seafood dishes while admiring panoramic views of the azure waters. Bophut Beach is also famous for its Fisherman's Village, where travelers can immerse themselves in the island's rich cultural heritage.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Known for its alluring Fisherman‚Äôs Village, exotic local markets, and swanky, comfortable seaside resorts and restaurants, Bophut Beach has a little something for everyone. Much of the architecture in the area around Bophut Beach is a unique mix of Chinese and Thai, giving it a distinct look and feel that most visitors find fascinating. Bophut Beach is a narrow arc filled with white sand and framed by majestic clusters of palm trees.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: The area of Bophut, to the east of Maenam, is a favorite amongst tourists and expats alike. Bophut Beach itself is not Samui‚Äôs best beach for swimming, but the Fisherman‚Äôs Village in Bophut is a must-visit for some simply amazing Thai street food and the Friday evening market. Grab some lunch from the hawkers‚Äô stalls, then take a stroll along the beach to aid digestion, or visit in the evening.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Koh Samui: 2024 Guide +Map

sources.snippet: Bophut Beach is a more quiet beach with a calm atmosphere on the northern part of Koh Samui, although it‚Äôs not one of the most isolated beaches. The stretch of sand is wide and the western part is a  good swimming beach  with an up-market feeling. In the east, the sand and water aren‚Äôt as good, but it‚Äôs closer to the restaurants and shops at Fisherman‚Äôs Village.
sources.shortName: The 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Bophut might not be the biggest beach on the island, but it's definitely one of the most beautiful. The three-kilometer-long stretch of sand is relatively quiet and kept in pristine condition by the many beachfront hotels here. Soft waves, crystal-clear waters, and rows of palm trees make Bophut an inviting place to relax under the sun.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches on Koh Samui

sources.snippet: There are almost only upper and middle class hotels everywhere along the beach of Bophut. In the east it ends at the shopping complex The Wharf, where you can also find the large Walking Street every Friday. The wide beach is largely clean because the beachfront hotels make sure that their guests have a beautiful beach on site.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches ‚Äì The 12 Most Beautiful Bays on the Island

sources.snippet: Known as the home to the famous Fisherman‚Äôs Village, Bo Phut is a 2km long beach that once had a traditional fisherman‚Äôs village. Nowadays, you will find a plethora of boutique resorts, restaurants, and watersports activities. The area is very peaceful and is a great place to enjoy the tranquility of Koh Samui.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches: Ultimate Guide to the Best Beaches

sources.snippet: Bophut Beach spreads along Fisherman‚Äôs Village walking street, packed with great restaurants and bars. The beach is beautiful, with nice views and stunning sunsets looking over Koh Phangan. What makes Bophut Beach and the area special is the relaxed atmosphere compared to Chaweng.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Koh Samui
5 Best beaches in Koh Samui | Chaweng, Bophut & more

sources.snippet: The long coastline at Bophut Beach, famous for watersports, could do the magic for you. The most memorable part of Bophut Beach is Fisherman‚Äôs Village. It is also a must-visit destination for a Friday‚Äôs Night Market with plenty of cozy shops, cafes, and street vendors.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Koh Samui review ~ Thailand

sources.snippet: Bophut Beach is a blend of traditional Thai charm and contemporary comfort. Known for its famous Fisherman‚Äôs Village, the beach offers a more laid-back and authentic experience. The soft sands and calm waters make it ideal for leisurely days spent lounging by the sea.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (With Map)

sources.snippet: Bophut Beach in Koh Samui is situated on the Northern point of the Island. Its beautiful white sand beach gently slopes down to crystal blue waters and attracts countless tourists every single day. A great place to chill and unwind in the sun.
sources.shortName: 6 Best Beaches In Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Originally known as the Fisherman‚Äôs Village, Bophut is fast becoming a major tourist attraction. If travelling with your family or with young children, this is the perfect location. Jet skiing is the most popular attraction at this beach.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Koh Samui For A Fun Filled Vacation in 2024

sources.snippet: Bophut Beach ‚Äì most famous for the Fishermans‚Äôs village, the actual beach is narrow with not much sand between the water and things on shore. If you‚Äôre after sweeping sandy white beaches, this is not the beach to go.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beach guide - what beach to stay at in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Bophut is all about that Fisherman‚Äôs Village charm, boasting well-preserved wooden houses, cute boutique shops, and a range of restaurants dishing up local and international flavours.
sources.shortName: Our 15 Favourite Beaches [+ Local Tips] [2025]

sources.snippet:
T
 he sea in Bophut is cloudy because of muddy suspended matter, which never sinks. It is definitely impossible to go snorkeling
 on this beach. The sand is reddish, coarse, grained.
sources.shortName: Ko Samui Beaches Guide ‚Äì www.kosamui.space

sources.snippet: It features two primary attractions: Bophut beach itself, which is found between Maenam and the Big Buddha; and the tranquil Fisherman‚Äôs Village, which is...
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches - Best Swimming, Diving, Snorkelling & Resorts, Map

places.name: Bo Phut Beach

reviews.text: Very pleasant hotel. Nice beach access and rooms. The staff was helpful and very nice. Some of them even remember our names! The breakfast was excellent and they offer lots of choice. And the hotel has lots of activities planned weekly.  The management staff actually walk around and speak with the guest. Which is a very old-school, but very nice touch! Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Hidden Gem in Ko Samui ‚Äì Fisherman's Village at Bo Phut Beach üåûüåä

Stumbled upon this charming¬†Fisherman's Village¬†during our Ko Samui adventure-and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip! Nestled along the picturesque¬†Bo Phut Beach, this spot perfectly blends laid-back beach vibes with vibrant island culture.

By day, it's a sun-drenched haven ‚òÄÔ∏è-great for strolling, beachside lounging, and popping into cozy caf√©s. But as the sun sets, the whole village transforms üåÖ‚ú®. The streets come alive with lights, music, and a buzzing energy that's both relaxing and exciting.

You'll find everything here:
üé®¬†Talented local artists¬†showcasing unique pieces
üíà¬†Trendy barbershops¬†with serious style
üíÖ¬†Chic nail parlors¬†for that perfect vacation manicure
üíÜ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è¬†Massage shops¬†offering pure bliss with an ocean breeze

And don't even get me started on the food-incredible beachside restaurants¬†serving up fresh seafood, Thai favorites, and global flavors in a cozy, candle-lit setting.

Whether you're looking to unwind or explore,¬†Fisherman's Village¬†is a must-visit slice of Ko Samui paradise.

Very coarse sand and unclear water, however, close access to food markets and fisherman's village which come alive at night. Some restaurants have beach access and it's nice to sit and listen to the waves. Great fires shows.

places.generalDescription: Silver Beach Resort, also known as Haad Thong Ta-khian, is a tranquil escape located just north of the bustling Lamai Beach in Koh Samui. The beach may be small, but it offers ample space and various family-friendly activities. Visitors can enjoy beachfront dining options, natural shade from trees, and excellent snorkeling opportunities along the rocky ends of the beach.

sources.snippet: Silver Beach (also known as Haad Thong Ta-khian or "the beach of the Ta-khian trees") might be just 250 meters of pristine white sand, but don't let that disappoint you. As beaches go, this is one of the best ones on the island. Four resorts and restaurants open up right over the sand, offering sun loungers, open-air dining, and plenty of umbrellas for when you need a break from sunbathing.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches on Koh Samui

places.name: Silver Beach Resort

reviews.text: CJ and Phon were so great to take our order , very helpful and professional, the restaurant in this place is a sea front of one of the best beaches in Samui ,  and surprisingly very affordable with excellent choices of food and drinks at street food prices , free parking and direct access to the beach with full facilities to ensure your day is wonderful, I highly recommend this place for dining or stay .

Terrible experience ‚Äì I strongly advise avoiding Silver Beach.
I have never in my life felt so disrespected and dismissed by hotel staff. The level of unprofessionalism and lack of basic courtesy was shocking. Instead of being treated as a guest, I was made to feel like a burden.
The staff showed zero interest in helping, and their attitude was cold, rude, and disrespectful throughout my stay.
This is not how you treat people who choose to spend their money and time at your property.
I will never return, and I absolutely do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

This beach is completely overrated. At Silver Beach Resort, you can rent sun loungers for 500 THB (2 loungers and 1 umbrella) for just 3 hours!!! A total rip-off ‚Äì there's no service, the loungers are ancient, no cushions, and there's not even a water hose to rinse off after a swim in the sea. Exactly after 3 hours, they show up and kick you out.

They should take a cue from other resorts where usage is tied to consumption. After all, in this heat, you end up ordering something anyway. That would be a more customer-friendly marketing approach.

The beach was overcrowded, and snorkeling‚Ä¶ well, there was nothing to see.

places.address: 124, 4, Maret, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84310, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Lamai Beach, located on the picturesque southeast coast of Koh Samui, is a tropical paradise that perfectly blends relaxation and adventure. This stunning stretch of white sand is adorned with swaying palm trees and lined with an array of bars and restaurants, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing or enjoying a refreshing drink. Visitors can rent lounge chairs to soak up the sun while taking in the breathtaking jade-green waters that are safe for swimming along most parts of the beach.

sources.snippet: Lamai Beach, the second most popular beach in Koh Samui, offers a more relaxed alternative to the hustle and bustle of Chaweng while maintaining its unique charm. Located in the southeast of the island, this stretch of fine sand about 4 kilometers long attracts visitors with its crystal-clear waters and more relaxing atmosphere. Lamai is distinguished by its impressive rock formations, including the famous "Hin Ta" and "Hin Yai" (Grandfather and Grandmother Rocks), which draw many visitors.
sources.shortName: Top 08 Best Beaches In Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: The Lamai Beach in Koh Samui appears to be endless, and it is definitely one of the best beaches in Koh Samui. The most beautiful places you are going to find in the southern part of the beach, where the large round rock formations protrude into the turquoise blue sea and conjure up a picture-perfect setting. This clean beach is very suitable for long beach walks and due to its length of about 4 kilometers, you will find numerous quiet spots for sunbathing and swimming.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (2024)

sources.snippet: Nestled on Koh Samui's southeastern coast, Lamai Beach offers a more laid-back and tranquil atmosphere compared to its bustling counterpart, Chaweng Beach. The soft golden sands and gentle waves create an idyllic setting for relaxation and rejuvenation. Visitors can explore the nearby Hin Ta and Hin Yai rock formations, shop for local handicrafts at the Lamai Walking Street, or simply unwind in the embrace of nature's beauty.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: After Chaweng, Lamai Beach is Koh Samui‚Äôs largest and most popular beach. Though it offers guests an array of amenities, it‚Äôs generally less chaotic than is Chaweng, making it a good choice for first-time visitors looking for a slower and more relaxed pace. Part of Lamai‚Äôs charm is that it‚Äôs slightly older and less developed than Chawing, giving it a noticeably quainter feel.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Lamai resort is second in size only to the main city of Chaweng. Although Lamai is a large city, due to the size of the beach - several kilometers long - you can never find it too busy if you are willing to find a quiet place. Lamai beach is also a great place for water sports or swimming, as the waters in the center of the beach are free of rocks and corals.
sources.shortName: The 10 best beaches on Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Lamai Beach Koh Samui is a stunning beach situated on the South East coast of the island. We spent some time hunting around the island, and Lamai Beach had some of the best powdery white sands and turquoise waters, even on an overcast day. Lamai Beach is the second most popular of the Koh Samui beaches after Chaweng Beach.
sources.shortName: 6 Best Beaches In Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Lamai Beach offers a tranquil alternative to its bustling neighbor, Chaweng. It‚Äôs known for its relaxed vibe and picturesque scenery, making it a favorite among those seeking a quieter beach experience. The softer sands and crystal-clear waters create a perfect setting for a leisurely swim or a sunbathing session.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (With Map)

sources.snippet: Lamai beach is the second largest beach on the island and offers a good compromise between animation and tranquility. Its calm waters, fine sand and coconut palms make it a place popular with couples, families and solitary travelers. The many restaurants, bars and shops located along the beach add to its charm.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches of Koh Samui: a tropical paradise to discover - Blog

sources.snippet: A short hop to the south from Silver Beach, and you will hit Lamai Beach. It‚Äôs a perfect beach for the family and is Samui‚Äôs second most popular beach. White sand, palm trees offering shade, and inviting water for a swim and a cool-off all make Lamai a perennial favorite for visitors to Samui.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Koh Samui: 2024 Guide +Map

sources.snippet: after Chaweng, Lamai Beach offers the best of amenities to tourists. Although the sunset is gorgeous, but if you can make it early to the beach then you can witness the most beautiful sunrise of your lifetime. Hire a deckchair and enjoy the breeze or get into the water for a relaxing swim.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Koh Samui For A Fun Filled Vacation in 2024

sources.snippet: Lamai Beach ‚Äì has gained a bit of reputation as being for cheap charlies, largely due to the fact that there‚Äôs a lot of cheaper hotels here. It‚Äôs the second largest Koh Samui beach but is noticeable quieter than Chaweng, although still has quite a few restaurants and shops around.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beach guide - what beach to stay at in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: More laid-back than Chaweng, Lamai still offers plenty of things to do - just at a more leisurely pace. Dining, shopping, and accommodations are also cheaper in Lamai, so it's a good destination for those on a budget. Smaller crowds doesn't mean Lamai is any less beautiful.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches on Koh Samui
5 Best beaches in Koh Samui | Chaweng, Bophut & more

sources.snippet: If your trip to Koh Samui would allow for it, we recommend exploring some of Lamai beach and kitesurfing on Maenam beach. Lamai beach is known for its iconic rocks, calm and shallow waters that are perfect for swimming. Lamai is the second busiest beach after Chaweng.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Koh Samui review ~ Thailand

sources.snippet: Lamai beach can get busy, especially during the high season, but nothing close to Chaweng beach. Lamai is the second longest beach in Koh Samui. There are many options for dining and shopping in Lamai, not as sophisticated as Chaweng or Bohput, but prices are better.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: The second most popular beach in Koh Samui is Lamai Beach south of Chaweng. Here you‚Äôll also find lots of hotels, restaurants and bars lined next to each other on the beach, but it‚Äôs a little  less crowded than Chaweng Beach. Pros: More calm than Chaweng.
sources.shortName: The 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: The Lamai Beach is also situated at the east coast of Koh Samui and is the second largest beach of the island after Chaweng Beach. The sand is not quite as fine as at the Chaweng Beach, but still very nice. Furthermore, it‚Äôs a great beach to take a swim.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches ‚Äì The 12 Most Beautiful Bays on the Island

sources.snippet: Lamai Beach is a quiet, relaxing resort destination in Koh Samui. It‚Äôs the second-largest beach area next to Chaweng, and it offers a wide range of accommodation, activities, shopping, and dining.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches - Best Swimming, Diving, Snorkelling & Resorts, Map

sources.snippet: Pro: Lots of restaurants and bars; Quieter beach compared to Chaweng. Con: Touristy; Sleazy. Next up the list is Lamai Beach which is the second most popular and busiest part of Koh Samui.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches: Ultimate Guide to the Best Beaches

places.name: Lamai Beach

reviews.text: Chill beach where you can actually swim without crazy waves like other spots on Samui. Long stretch of sand, great vibes, and perfect for just kicking back and relaxing

Beautiful beach, lots of places to hang on the beach. Whether placing down a towel or renting a beach chair for 100 baht.

The sand was white and soft. Tons of restaurants and massage places. We stayed right on Lamai beach for 7 nights.

My only issue was the rough water. Every day the waves just pounded you. They would knock you down and drag you in the sand. Not very relaxing and not good for small children or bringing any floaty devices. The sun rises here so have to watch where you go as gets shaded in the afternoon. Have to keep moving your towel.

No sunsets on this beach.

Lamai Beach was a good spot for a swim. The water was clear and calm when I went. It was easy to just float around and relax. It wasn't too crowded either, so I didn't feel like I had to dodge people all the time. Overall, a nice and simple place to spend a few hours in the water.

places.generalDescription: Thongson Beach is a secluded and picturesque white sand beach located to the south of the naval base peninsula at Lipa Noi. It features palm-fringed shores and an offshore reef, making it a beautiful spot for relaxation. While swimming may be limited during certain times of the year due to shallow waters, it offers a tranquil setting for unwinding with a book while enjoying views of the Gulf of Thailand. Additionally, visitors can find luxury beachfront villas in this area.

sources.snippet: The Thongson Beach is a true beach jewel of Koh Samui Island. It is located at the northeastern tip of the popular vacation island, far away from the hustle and bustle, and is still an insider tip for an unforgettable beach vacation. This absolutely enchanting bathing bay inspires with a unique tranquility, with a lot of relaxed flair and with a dream beach scenery of the finest.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (2024)

sources.snippet: The next bay over from Samrong is home to the delightful Thongson Beach. The shallow water is not deep enough to call Thongson a swimming beach, but it‚Äôs a secluded little beach and a beautiful place to chill with a book while gazing out over the Gulf of Thailand.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Koh Samui: 2024 Guide +Map

places.name: Thongson Beach

reviews.text:
Thongson Bay bungalow is Mr. Pongs lovely family resort. I was there 1996 first time and it's still the same charme and still same beautiful and quiet there...
When you climb/walk right side 10 minutes over the rocks you will find an empty bay, 50m wide where is nobody... No street or walkway thru the woods!!

Nice shallow beach with clear water. Rented sunbed and towel for 100baht each per day.

If you want go deeper, there is no option because of rocks. In general water is very comfy, no trash, beach is not crowded.

Closer to the evening they set dining tables in the beach right in front of water. Nice view
Our heaven. The restaurant has great food at cheap prices.

places.generalDescription: Salt Society, located on Chaweng beach, exudes an effortlessly cool and understated elegance. The generous buffet spread features sections with imported fresh oysters, tiger prawns, crab, and clams. It's a perfect spot for a romantic dinner by the ocean. Guests can enjoy exquisite food and excellent service at resort prices. While some felt that the dessert options were lacking in variety, others appreciated the complimentary lavender sorbet offered after dinner.

sources.snippet: Enjoy cocktails, stunning views, and delicious food at Salt Society, one of Koh Samui‚Äôs top beach bars on Chaweng Beach.
sources.shortName: Chaweng Beach

places.name: Salt Society ‚Äì Beach Bar & Kitchen

reviews.text: This place is so good! We went for lunch last week and really enjoyed it. The food is very fresh and light. It definitely refreshing from all the heavy rice and noodles we had been having the whole time we were in Thailand. The cocktails were so esthetic and also tasted great. To top it off the restaurant is so pretty and has great views. I would recommend coming here.

The location is superb! Overlooking the beach and almost having your toes in the sand. Overall the food was great. However, the salmon tartare had way too much lime so the taste of the salmon kinda disappeared. The soup should also be warmer. Preferably always too hot to eat after serving and then it will cool down in a few minutes.

Had a nice dinner at Salt Society! The restaurant is absolutely stunning - right on the beach with a beautiful, modern aesthetic that's perfect for dining. The food was tasty and well-presented, and the extensive salt selection was a fun and unique touch.

Prices are quite high by Thailand standards, but comparable to what you'd expect in Australia or other Western countries. Definitely worth it for a one-off special dinner, though not something I'd budget for every night. Overall, a lovely spot if you're looking for a more upscale dining experience in Koh Samui.

places.address: 38/2 Moo 3 Borpud, Chaweng Beach, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Choengmon Beach is nestled in a gentle crescent on the northeast corner of Koh Samui, offering a diverse range of dining, drinking, and accommodation options to suit various preferences and budgets. The area is known for its upscale ambiance, with luxurious multi-star resorts dominating the backdrop. Visitors seeking pampering can indulge in the amenities offered by 5-star hotels like the White House or the Imperial Boat House without having to venture far for their needs.

sources.snippet: Located in a shallow crescent on the island‚Äôs northeast corner, Choeng Mon Beach is surrounded by an impressive variety of eating, drinking, and lodging establishments catering to those of nearly all tastes and budgets. Considered one of the island‚Äôs more upscale locales, Choeng Mon Beach‚Äôs backdrop is dominated by a few luxurious multi-star resorts that are the perfect choices for those who want to be pampered and are willing to pay for it. If 5-star resorts are your cup of tea, you‚Äôll be happy staying in one of Choeng Mon Beach‚Äôs nice hotels like the White House or the Imperial Boat House; with nearly all the amenities you‚Äôll need onsite, you‚Äôll only have to venture out if you really want to.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Beloved by couples and families for its calm ambiance and relaxing atmosphere, Cheong Mon Beach is home to fantastic white sand and swaying palm trees. Located just 10 minutes away from the more bustling Chaweng Beach, this bay rarely get crowded, making it perfect for a peaceful day in the sun. Thrill-seekers can participate in a variety of water sports, while those looking for a quieter way to spend their day can enjoy a massage on the beach or unwind at the many restaurants and bars.
sources.shortName: 6 Best, Most Beautiful Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Choeng Mon Beach, tucked away in a tranquil bay on the northeastern tip of the island, offers a serene and family-friendly retreat. The shallow waters and soft sands make it an ideal spot for swimming and sunbathing, while the surrounding area features upscale resorts and luxury villas. Choeng Mon Beach is also a gateway to other islands, offering opportunities for island-hopping adventures and snorkeling excursions.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Our pick of the best beaches around Koh Samui is Chaweng Noi beach (most beautiful), Silver beach and Coral Cove beach (best snorkeling), Lipa Noi beach and Choeng Mon beach (most quiet). Overall, Koh Samui does not disappoint, giving you an assortment of beautiful beaches alongside fantastic experiences to make them all worth it. Fortunately, all the best beaches are just a short ride from one another.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Koh Samui review ~ Thailand

sources.snippet: Choeng Mon Beach, located in a secluded bay in the northeast of Koh Samui, is a 700-meter stretch of white sand that serves as a peaceful haven. Surrounded by rocky headlands, it offers calm waters ideal for swimming and families. Less crowded than the island's major beaches, Choeng Mon Beach combines tranquility with amenities, featuring a few high-end resorts and discreet beach restaurants.
sources.shortName: Top 08 Best Beaches In Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: If you are looking for beaches in Koh Samui that are not very far from the thoroughfare but is not extremely noisy and crowded, Choeng Mon Beach should be on your list. Located close to Chaweng, the beach is protected from noisy tourists by intervening coastlines. It is best suited for family vacations and for those who love luxurious holidays.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Koh Samui For A Fun Filled Vacation in 2024

sources.snippet: If you take the scenic coastal road from Chaweng to visit the Big Buddha statue and temple, you will pass by Choeng Mon Beach. Quieter than its more boisterous neighbor, Choeng Mon Beach is another of Samui‚Äôs top family-friendly beaches. The center of the beach is the best place for swimming.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Koh Samui: 2024 Guide +Map

sources.snippet: Choeng Mon Beach isn‚Äôt a place you‚Äôll randomly stumble into as public access is limited. Therefore mainly  frequented by holidaymakers staying at the resorts, the vibe here is different to some of the other beaches in Koh Samui. It seems to be particularly popular with European travellers.
sources.shortName: The 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Choeng Mon Beach is a haven for families and those seeking a tranquil beach experience. Its sheltered bay ensures calm and shallow waters, safe for children to play and swim. The beach is fringed with fine, soft sand and dotted with inviting beachfront resorts and restaurants.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (With Map)

sources.snippet: Choeng Mon Beach is located at the Northeastern tip of the island. You can access the beach through the first line hotels in Choeng Mon. Despite having direct access from several resorts, Choeng Mon Beach tends to be reasonably relaxed depending on the season.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet:
T
 he best place for swimming on Choeng Mon Beach is in the very centre. This part of the beach only stretches for a 
 few hundreds of meters, but it‚Äôs quite wide, so it doesn‚Äôt seem cramped at all. The sand is fine and light here.
sources.shortName: Ko Samui Beaches Guide ‚Äì www.kosamui.space

sources.snippet: The Choeng Mon Beach is located at the northeast coast of Samui. There are a few resorts at the beach, but it‚Äôs still very quiet and not too crowded. A nice and cozy beach, a great spot to relax and swim.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches ‚Äì The 12 Most Beautiful Bays on the Island

sources.snippet: Choeng Mon beach is a highly recommended destination in Koh Samui for travellers who value privacy. Located on the north-eastern area of the island, there‚Äôs a handful of elegant resorts to choose from.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches - Best Swimming, Diving, Snorkelling & Resorts, Map

places.name: Choeng Mon Beach

reviews.text:
Choeng Mon Beach ‚Äì Soft Sand, Clear Water & Tiny Island Vibes!

Back again at Choeng Mon Beach-and let me tell you, this place still slaps harder than a spicy som tam! I used to know it from my lazy days at Sala Samui, and yep, it's still one of Ko Samui's top-tier beaches, right up there with Chaweng Noi. If beaches had an elite club, Choeng Mon would definitely be on the VIP list.

The sand? Smoother than a Thai massage on a Tuesday. The water? So clear you'll start judging your drinking water at home. Perfect for swimming, floating like a starfish, or just dramatically pretending you're in a perfume commercial.

And now‚Ä¶ drumroll please‚Ä¶ the real gem: that adorable little island (‡πÄ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏•‡πá‡∏Å‡πÜ‡∏ô‡πà‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏Å!) just off the shore! At low tide, you can actually walk across to it like some sort of tropical Moses. It's perfect for mini-adventures, selfies, or just yelling ‚ÄúI've discovered land!‚Äù to your friends.

Ideal for families, couples, solo travelers, or wandering bat-creatures like me. It's peaceful, not too crowded, and has just the right amount of beach bars to keep your coconut hydrated inside and out.

Batty's verdict: Beach level 10/10, would build a sandcastle again.
‚Äú‡∏™‡∏ß‡∏¢‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö!‚Äù ‚Äì That means ‚Äúvery beautiful‚Äù, and so is this beach.
Now excuse me while I go write my name in the sand like a drama queen.
Beautiful Beach perfect for quiet sunrises and the sunset is amazing as well. Perfect beach for families, easy parking if your not staying with in walking distance. A must vist while on Koh Samui!

Nice family beach. Free parking in sandy carpark near the middle or enter via any of the resorts and cafes. Best swimming is full tide. Jet skis and efoils and sailing boats and stand up paddle boards (and lessons) all available. Check seasonal forecasts during wet season October to January wet season cause some onshore waves. Some very nice photo opportunity and good value food places. Thai massage huts on the beach too.

places.address: Pure Beach Club Rd, Bo Put, Amphoe Ko Samui, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Bang Rak Beach, also known as Big Buddha Beach, is not the ideal spot for swimming due to its cloudy water and limited comfortable entry points. However, the central area near the piers provides a suitable swimming environment even during low tide. The beach is home to the famous Big Buddha Temple and offers various accommodation options including hotels with private villas and resorts with common facilities like pools and air conditioning.

sources.snippet:
B
 ig Buddha, or Bang Rak, is not the best beach on Koh Samui for swimming. The water here is cloudy, a proper depth 
 and a comfortable entrance into the water are only in the central part of the beach, that‚Äôs where the piers for
 speedboats and speedy catamarans are situated, they cruise between Koh Samui and nearby islands. You can swim easily 
 here even at low tide, what local kids and employees of water sports centres, located on the coast of Bang Rak, 
 use with great pleasure.
sources.shortName: Ko Samui Beaches Guide ‚Äì www.kosamui.space

sources.snippet: Bangrak Beach, also known as Big Buddha Beach, is located on the north side of the island. The beach is a long strip of sand along Bangrak Bay. There are a number of resorts, bars and restaurants, and the pier, with boats departing to Koh Phangan and Koh Tao.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: Bang Rak Beach, also known as the Big Buddha Beach, is one of Koh Samui‚Äôs most popular areas. The nickname of Big Buddha Beach came from the sight of the massive Buddha statue, which is visible from the eastern...
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches - Best Swimming, Diving, Snorkelling & Resorts, Map

places.name: Bang Rak Beach

reviews.text: If you are looking for a more laidback beach on Samui, this is the place for you. We were here in March and the beach was very clean. Bangrak has more of a local vibe and there are many good restaurants, caf√©s and bars. Some beach clubs like Tembo or Chi Samui provide a party feeling, but the beach is otherwise very quiet and definitely offers a good mix for everyone, including families.

A lovely beach walk, with plenty of restaurants dotted up and down it. It was very windy while we were there so we didn't go swimming in the water but wandering up the beach was pleasant. I will say that the hackers that walk up and down the beach can be a bit pushy though, we had the same person pass us a few times & each time they tried to sell us something we didn't want or need.
Beach clean but water looked not clean, guess it wouldn't pass an EU Blue Flag

places.address: H25X+4M7, 4171, Ko Samui District, Surat Thani 84320, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Chaweng Beach is a vibrant and expansive stretch of sand that captures the essence of Koh Samui's lively atmosphere. This popular destination attracts visitors from around the world, offering an array of nearby resorts, restaurants, and shopping options. With its bustling nightlife and a market that spans three kilometers, Chaweng Beach is perfect for those looking to indulge in retail therapy or savor delicious local cuisine. Whether you're on the hunt for trendy swimwear or unique souvenirs, you'll find it all here.

sources.snippet: Chaweng Beach, a gem on the east coast of Koh Samui, stretches for 7 kilometers of white sand bathed by crystal-clear turquoise waters. Known as the most popular and lively beach on the island, it offers a perfect blend of natural beauty and developed tourist infrastructure. Visitors find a multitude of water activities, hotels for all budgets, vibrant nightlife, and excellent shopping and dining options.
sources.shortName: Top 08 Best Beaches In Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: For those determined travelers who won‚Äôt settle for anything less than the best, Chaweng Beach arguably packs the best bang for those hard-earned travel dollars. It‚Äôs a stone‚Äôs throw from the airport, Angthong National Marine Park, and a popular Muay Thai kickboxing stadium too. Chaweng Beach also has a reputation as a place to party and has a noticeably younger crowd than other island beaches.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Chaweng Beach is the main Koh Samui beach and also the most popular, by far. Sometimes it‚Äôs hard to sit back and relax on your chair on the beach without having someone coming up to you and trying to sell you something every 5 minutes, especially if you‚Äôre a honky (white face). This is where all the action is and also where a lot of the backpackers stay.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beach guide - what beach to stay at in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: The approximately 6 km long Chaweng Beach is probably the most famous beach on Koh Samui. Here you will find some of the best places for where to stay in Koh Samui and there is a great choice of restaurants as well as a legendary nightlife. Nevertheless, at this endlessly wide and clean beach, you will still find quiet places to relax and sunbathe.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (2024)

sources.snippet: Interestingly, a list of Koh Samui‚Äôs best beaches always starts with a mention of the Chaweng Beach, which lies next to Chaweng Noi. Being the biggest beach on the island, it also looks to be the most developed of all the beaches around. The only tradeoff to all the fun you could have here is that it also happens to be the busiest of the bunch.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Koh Samui review ~ Thailand

sources.snippet: Chaweng is one of the main tourist hot spot beach destinations and is where all the action happens. Although it is the busiest, it is also one of the prettiest, with a long 7km stretch of white sand. While there are some large resorts in the area, the crowd in Chaweng tends to be younger as a lot of popular beach bars can be found in the area.
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches: Ultimate Guide to the Best Beaches

sources.snippet: Chaweng Beach, renowned as Koh Samui‚Äôs liveliest spot, is a must-visit for beachgoers and party lovers alike. Its expansive stretch of powdery white sand is ideal for sun worshippers, while the azure waters beckon swimmers and water sports enthusiasts. As the sun sets, Chaweng‚Äôs vibrant personality shines through its bustling nightlife scene.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui (With Map)

sources.snippet: Koh Samui's largest beach is known for its glistening azure waters and soft white sands. Although Chaweng Beach is seven kilometers long, its high popularity means it's often crowded and rarely quiet. But if you're looking for big waves, lots of action, plenty of water sports opportunities, and a chance to dive, then this is your beach.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches on Koh Samui

sources.snippet: The Chaweng Beach is located at the east coast of Koh Samui and is the most popular one of the island. Despite the many visitors, the beach is really clean, which is mostly because of all the hotels that are situated directly at the beach. You can find some cheaper bungalows at the northern end, as well as the famous Ark Bar.
sources.siteName: Home is where your Bag is - Travel Blog & Travel Tips
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches ‚Äì The 12 Most Beautiful Bays on the Island

sources.snippet: Chaweng Beach needs no introduction‚Äîit's Koh Samui's most famous and vibrant beach, and for a good reason. Stretching for 6 kilometres, this beach offers an array of activities and amenities, making it perfect for those seeking a lively atmosphere. From beach bars and water sports to lively beach parties, Chaweng has it all.
sources.shortName: 6 Best, Most Beautiful Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: If you are the sort of traveller who likes to be in the middle of the action then Chawang Beach on the eastern coast of Koh Samui, might be the right spot for you. This is the epicenter of the island for visitors. Built up around a stunning, long arc of white sand and close to the airport, Chaweng, the island‚Äôs main beach.
sources.shortName: The Beaches in Koh Samui: 2024 Guide +Map
5 Best beaches in Koh Samui | Chaweng, Bophut & more

sources.snippet: Chaweng Beach is one of the most popular and vibrant beaches on the island, boasting powdery white sand and crystal-clear turquoise waters. It is characterized by its lively atmosphere, with an array of beachfront bars, restaurants, and shops lining the coastline. Chaweng Beach has something for everyone.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: The most  developed  and  touristy beach in Koh Samui is Chaweng Beach on the east coast. The huge beach is beautiful with soft sand and there‚Äôs plenty of room to find a great spot to lay on the sand or rent a sunbed. There are resorts, restaurants, snack bars, souvenir shops and all kinds of activities.
sources.shortName: The 8 Best Beaches in Koh Samui, Thailand

sources.snippet: Chaweng Beach, with its fine white sand and turquoise water, is one of the most popular beaches on the island. Chaweng area is the most developed and touristy area in Koh Samui, with plenty of resorts, restaurants, bars, shops, food stands. Night-life in Koh Samui is vibrant, especially in Chaweng.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Koh Samui

sources.snippet: One of the largest and most popular beaches in Koh Samui, Chaweng Beach attracts tourists all year round. With lines of coconut trees for miles and clean, white sand, this beach is the perfect choice for beach lovers. And you will easily find a suitable stay option very close to the beach.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches in Koh Samui For A Fun Filled Vacation in 2024

sources.snippet: Chaweng is undoubtedly one of the most popular beaches of Koh Samui. With its many hotels, bars, restaurants and clubs, it is the island's nerve center in terms of activities and nightlife. Its fine sand and its crystalline water seduce lovers of idleness and swimming.
sources.shortName: The most beautiful beaches of Koh Samui: a tropical paradise to discover - Blog

sources.snippet: The most popular of the beaches in Koh Samui is definitely  Chaweng Beach!. It‚Äôs situated right in the hub of the most touristy part of the island and is generally where people book their stay. With it being so easily accessible, it does get super busy in peak season.
sources.shortName: 6 Best Beaches In Koh Samui

sources.snippet:
A
 true fan of swimming may be charmed by Chaweng, yet, may be appalled. It depends on the part of the beach you choose for a swim. The northern part of the beach, situated opposite a small satellite island Koh Matlang, has the most winding coast line.
sources.shortName: Ko Samui Beaches Guide ‚Äì www.kosamui.space

sources.snippet: It is found on the island‚Äôs north-eastern coast and is the longest beach area of the island. It is also the biggest and busiest resort town, and it is where...
sources.shortName: Koh Samui Beaches - Best Swimming, Diving, Snorkelling & Resorts, Map

sources.snippet: The beach stretches for 5 km, which means there is always room for a pleasant walk or swim in the sea. If you live in Chaweng, you're in luck.
sources.shortName: The 10 best beaches on Koh Samui

places.name: Chaweng Beach

reviews.text: Lovely beach, sometimes busy but never overly packed. Nice scenery and restaurants dotted along the beach

Large beach of several kilometers where it is good to walk. The color of the water changes according to the weather. Beware the sea is sometimes very rough with a lot of waves.
Lots of massage tent all along and many bars and restaurants to enjoy the view.

We weren't sure whether to bother with this beach initially, a slight concern that it might be crazy busy and full of rubbish etc‚Ä¶ however I'm glad we did because it's one of the most beautiful beaches on Samui.

Sand colour on any beach can appear to change from white to yellow depending on the sun/conditions, but the few days we spent here it was white sand and calm blue waters.

Theres loads to do with bars, restaurants and sunbeds to rent. Plus jet skis etc for those that are interested. It wasn't too busy in June and there was no hassle from beach sellers. The planes coming in and out of Samui Airport made for an interesting back drop too.
